Thanks to every translator and every user who helped shape up this app!
If you found a wrong or missing translation, you can submit a correction yourself at http://www.getlocalization.com/noFrillsCPUClassic/
Q: What is a governor? Can you explain the differencies among them?

CPU frequency scaling allows you to change the clock speed of CPUs on the fly. This can save power, because the lower the CPU clock speed, the less power the CPU consumes. Governors are different policies to scale frequency.\nExplaining the differencies is a long answer, please read it at the homepage (http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=911917) .
Q: Do you plan on adding profiles? I\'d love to select a different profile for when my screen is off!

A: Short answer is \"No\". I think that profiles are useless, because that\'s what governors are already: a profile for your CPU to follow while changing frequencies.\nAdding profiles would mean adding the need for more memory, the need to run more often, check if something is happening (screen on, screen off and so on)… all of this without a real benefit.
The theme will be applied next time the app is started.
No check for unclean shutdown will be performed.
Values won\'t be applied in case of an unclean shutdown.
Are you sure you want to disable the safety valve? Proceed ONLY if you know what you are doing.
Other apps (or the system) will be prevented from changing frequencies.
Other apps (or the system) will be able to change frequencies.
This feature is needed only on Android 4.1 (Jelly Bean), recent HTC One or similar devices. Are you sure you want to proceed?
Type a vibration pattern expressed in milliseconds (e.g.: 0,50,100,50,100) or leave this field blank to use the default vibration pattern.
Current frequency will be updated periodically.
Current frequency will be updated when refreshing stats.
